channel.title: Small Yields
channel.description: Small Yields is a collection of stories about unpretentious wines, their renegade makers, and their passionate followers. It's for anyone who enjoys sharing a glass off the beaten path and in good company. Occasionally, it also acts as a space to explore the messy process of writing and creating, a reminder that great work is also about failing and trying again.

item.title: Day 3
item.description:
It’s day three, and what have I produced? I have five hundred words. A baby chapter…which took me two days to write and still needs editing.

They say you have to show up to the page. Every. Day. I missed yesterday’s USA-ENG women’s quarter-final game for this. I’m missing the other quarter-final game today. All that so that I can show up to the page. And produce a sentence per hour.

Writing is freakin’ hard. That self-righteous Millenial Medium blogger was probably right: I have nothing worthy to say. I’m just trying not to be an online polluter. The Internet is already so gross and dirty. I don’t want to add to the plethora of bad writing out there and create more word pollution.

I got hungry, so I grabbed the closest resemblance to junk food I could find in my kitchen: Trader Joe’s unsweetened coconut chips. Yesterday, I finished the candied ginger hiding at the back of my cupboard. It was a bit stale but edible. The day before that, I chewed through an old pack of gum I found at the bottom of my purse. There was a faded receipt stuck to the last piece. It tasted like expired mint chapstick. Am I the only one who needs to snack while she writes? Déjà vu, I’m reliving my freshman year. I’ve tried offsetting the munchies with tea, water, iced coffee. I could start day drinking. That was a thing writers did before, right? Although it would make me sleepy. I could scrounge for the peanut butter jar. Wait. I haven’t kept any in the house for years, not since the overdose incident in my senior year. It’s all coming back to me now.

Shit, I’ve been sitting here for hours?! I didn’t realize that I’ve skipped lunch. (The coconut chip craving is starting to make sense). Can I call it a day now? I need to go to the grocery store and get me some fuel. I’m going to get fat on writing. Oh look, I surpassed this week’s daily word count record. By twenty-seven words. Today’s word count: 359

item.title: Polaroid Williamsburg

Etsy squid occupy pop-up. Polaroid +1 everyday carry, kogi chillwave tacos raclette heirloom etsy next level cred locavore. Blog street art DIY, pug crucifix asymmetrical chicharrones.
